summary: The Claiming Age Clarity Act (S. 1504) mandates the Social Security Administration to update its terminology. The bill requires the replacement of terms like "early eligibility age," "full retirement age," and "delayed retirement credit" with new terms like "minimum monthly benefit age," "standard monthly benefit age," and "maximum monthly benefit age," respectively, in all Social Security Administration materials, both online and in print, by January 1, 2027.
